title: Evaluating the Usability of LLMs in Creative Writing Assistance
description: This research aims to evaluate the usability of large language models (LLMs) in assisting creative writing tasks, focusing on their ability to generate coherent narratives, character development, and thematic consistency.
motivation: While LLMs have shown potential in generating text, their application in creative writing remains underexplored. Current models often produce text that lacks depth and creativity, which are crucial for storytelling. This study seeks to address these limitations by developing a framework to assess and enhance the creative capabilities of LLMs.
milestones: Conduct literature review on existing LLMs and creative writing assistance tools.
Identify and select the most relevant LLMs for the study.
Design a methodology for evaluating LLM usability in creative writing.
Prepare datasets for testing LLMs' creative writing capabilities.
Develop metrics for assessing narrative coherence, character development, and thematic consistency.
Train selected LLMs using the prepared datasets.
Conduct initial tests to gauge LLM performance.
Analyze initial testing results and refine evaluation criteria.
Engage with creative writing experts for qualitative feedback on LLM outputs.
Iterate on LLM models based on expert feedback.
Perform detailed usability tests with improved LLM models.
Compile test results and compare against initial criteria.
Draft a report summarizing findings, methodologies, and insights.
Present findings at a relevant academic or industry conference.
